content: Since you've stated in the constraints that negative numbers are allowed, you should include test cases with negative numbers, both as inputs and as outputs.
Not yet reviewed the puzzle, but removed the tag "Maths" to be consistent with already published puzzles (which use the tag "Mathematics" only).

Would someone introduce me to the process? This puzzle is pending; what does it take to make it a fully-fledged puzzle? Can I make other peoples' puzzles no longer pending or does it take someone with more reputation than me?

I thought there was a community puzzle on this theme so I did a search... Ah, https://www.codingame.com/training/hard/balanced-ternary-computer-encode

(EDIT: changed difficulty to easy on 27 Jun 2018. The link above is invalid.)

This puzzle has more requirements than that, so it's not a duplicate.
I wouldn't tag this as "Parsing" (one expression in three lines?!?) but for the rest it is interesting and well crafted.

Right, I was aware of the existing exemplar and decided this is considerably different. He calls his "Hard" and I call mine "Medium". I'm open to adjusting the difficulty according to others' reactions. I was going to make mine a code clash, but decided it was too involved. Thanks for looking!
I'll PM and reply to you.
Excellent idea. I thought I had, but I see I haven't. Thanks!

As I understand, everyone is entitled to review a community contribution. When you get three approvals your contribution is accepted; when you get three refusals... it is not.
To approve/refuse you first craft your own solution, take a good look at the puzzle and see if it's all OK, then use the "..." button top middle in the puzzle's sub-window and use the relevant button. There's a checklist to remind you of what your duties are as a reviewer but after that it's done!
Not quite everyone. I received a Forum message detailing the process. Thanks for the response!
There's a minimum level maybe? Would you share the forum message? Thanks!
Can you see this? https://www.codingame.com/forum/t/puzzle-approval-process/40722 It points to this: https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzles-updates/36643/40
The second link did it, thanks! So you have to be level 20 or higher to do that... I didn't even realize I started looking at the contribution only after reaching the level!

Well community puzzles used to be shown in their own section. At the time of merging with the classical puzzles the difficulty was assigned by codingame not the author.

We'll see if we have to adjust that puzzle's difficulty after going through your puzzle.
In the statement I've added a link to the other puzzle which I've just reclassified as Easy. If the difficulty levels seem unappropriate please do reclassify again.
